paragraph.content: for the payment or transfer out of court of any such funds as are mentioned in sub-paragraph (c),

subsection.continued: is made the application may be disposed of in chambers.

subsection.content: Subject to paragraph (3), any such application must be made by summons and, unless the application is made in a pending cause or matter or an application for the same purpose has previously been made by petition or originating summons, the summons must be an originating summons.

Where an application under paragraph (1)(d) is required to be made by originating summons, then, if the funds to which the application relates do not exceed $50,000 in value, the application may be made ex parte to a master and the master may dispose of the application or may direct it to be made by originating summons. Unless otherwise directed, an ex parte application under this paragraph shall be made by affidavit.
This rule does not apply to any application for an order under Order 22A. (L.N. 152 of 2008)

section.name: s93
section.heading: The Variation of Trusts Ordinance (Cap. 253)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Application under Variation of Trusts Ordinance (O. 93, r. 6)

subsection.content: In addition to any other persons who are necessary and proper defendants to the originating summons by which an application under section 3 of the Variation of Trusts Ordinance (Cap. 253), is made, the settlor and any other person who provided property for the purposes of the trusts to which the application relates must, if still alive and not the plaintiff, be made a defendant unless the Court for some special reason otherwise directs.

section.name: s95
section.heading: The Bills of Sale Ordinance (Cap. 20) and Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Rectification of register (O. 95, r. 1)

subsection.leadIn: Every application to the Court under section 20 of the Bills of Sale Ordinance (Cap. 20) for an order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that any omission to register a bill of sale or an affidavit of renewal thereof within the time prescribed by that Ordinance be rectified by extending the time for such registration, or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that any omission or mis-statement of the name, residence or occupation of any person be rectified by the insertion in the register of his true name, residence or occupation,

subsection.continued: must be made by affidavit ex parte to a master.

subsection.content: Every application for such an order as is described in paragraph (1) shall be supported by an affidavit setting out particulars of the bill of sale and of the omission or mis-statement in question and stating the grounds on which the application is made.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Entry of satisfaction (O. 95, r. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Every application under section 21 of the Bills of Sale Ordinance (Cap. 20) to a master for an order that a memorandum of satisfaction be written on a registered copy of a bill of sale must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a consent to the satisfaction signed by the person entitled to the benefit of the bill of sale can be obtained, be made ex parte;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in all other cases, be made by originating summons.

subsection.leadIn: An ex parte application under paragraph (1)(a) must be supported by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: particulars of the consent referred to in that paragraph; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an affidavit by a witness who attested the consent verifying the signature on it.

subsection.content: An originating summons under paragraph (1)(b) must be served on the person entitled to the benefit of the bill of sale and must be supported by evidence that the debt (if any) for which the bill of sale was made has been satisfied or discharged.
An originating summons under paragraph (1)(b) shall be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Restraining removal on sale of goods seized (O. 95, r. 3)
section.content: An originating summons by which an application to the Court under the proviso to section 14 of the Bills of Sale Ordinance (Cap. 20) must be made shall be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Search of register (O. 95, r. 4)
section.content: The Registrar shall, on a request in writing giving sufficient particulars, and on payment of the prescribed fee, cause a search to be made in the register of bills of sale and issue a certificate of the result of the search.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Assignment of book debts (O. 95, r. 6)

subsection.content: There shall continue to be kept in the Registry a register of assignment of book debts.

subsection.leadIn: Every application for registration of an assignment of a book debt under section 48 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) shall be made by producing at the Registry—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a true copy of the assignment, and of every schedule thereto, and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an affidavit verifying the date and the time, and the due execution of the assignment in the presence of the deponent, and setting out the particulars of the assignment, and of the parties thereto.

subsection.content: On an application being made in accordance with the preceding paragraph, the documents there referred to shall be filed and the particulars of the assignment and the parties to it, shall be entered in the register.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Trade Marks Ordinance (Cap. 559)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation (O. 100, r. 1)

subsection.leadIn: In this Order—
subsection.def: Court (法院) means the Court of First Instance;
the Ordinance (《條例》) means the Trade Marks Ordinance (Cap. 559);
the Trade Marks Rules (《商標規則》) means the Trade Marks Rules (Cap. 559 sub. leg. A).

subsection.content: In this Order, a section referred to by number means the section so numbered in the Ordinance.
Expressions used in this Order that are used in the Ordinance have the same meaning in this Order as in the Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application (O. 100, r. 2)
section.content: These rules apply to proceedings brought before the Court under or for the purposes of the Ordinance subject to the provisions of this Order.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application under the Ordinance (O. 100, r. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to rules 4 and 5, an application to the Court under the Ordinance must be made by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: writ; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: originating summons in Form No. 8, 10 or 11 in Appendix A.

subsection.content: If an application is made in accordance with paragraph (1), the plaintiff or the plaintiff’s agent must serve a copy of the writ or originating summons by which the application is made on the Registrar of Trade Marks within 7 days after the issue of the writ or originating summons.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application under section 23 or 25 (O. 100, r. 4)

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 23 or 25 must be made by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: originating summons in Form No. 8, 10 or 11 in Appendix A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is made in a pending action—summons in that action; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: including the application in a writ, statement of claim or counterclaim.

subsection.leadIn: If an application under section 25 is made in accordance with paragraph (1) in respect of any infringing goods, material or articles (infringing item)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant must give a written notice of the application to all persons who have an interest in the infringing item so far as reasonably ascertainable at the same time when the application is served under these rules on the party against whom the application is made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who has an interest in the infringing item (whether or not a notice mentioned in subparagraph (a) is given to the person) is entitled to appear in proceedings in respect of the application.

subsection.leadIn: A reference in paragraph (2) to a person who has an interest in an infringing item includes a person in whose favour an order could be made in respect of the item under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 25;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 54(1) of the Registered Designs Ordinance (Cap. 522); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 111 or 231 of the Copyright Ordinance (Cap. 528).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Proceedings for infringement of registered trade marks: defendants may contest registration etc. (O. 100, r. 5)

subsection.leadIn: If in any proceedings begun by writ in respect of a registered trade mark a claim is made for relief for infringement of the trade mark, the defendant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may contest the registration of the trade mark in the defence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may make a counterclaim for any one or more of the following reliefs—

subparagraph.content: an order for the revocation of the registration of the trade mark;
a declaration of invalidity of the registration of the trade mark;
an order for the variation of the registration of the trade mark;
an order for rectification of the register.

subsection.content: The defence or counterclaim must include particulars of the objections to the registration of the trade mark on which the defendant relies.

subsection.leadIn: The defendant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must serve a copy of the defence or counterclaim on all other parties to the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the defendant makes a counterclaim for a relief under paragraph (1)(b)—must serve a copy of the counterclaim on the Registrar of Trade Marks at the same time of filing the counterclaim.

subsection.content: If the Registrar of Trade Marks takes part in the proceedings, the Registrar of Trade Marks need not serve any pleading unless ordered to do so by the Court.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Reference to Court under section 77(1)(b) etc. (O. 100, r. 6)

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar of Trade Marks refers to the Court under section 77(1)(b) an application on a question concerning a registered trade mark or an application for registration of a trade mark; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar of Trade Marks has given to the parties and the Court written notice of the decision of such reference (notice of decision) of an application (original application) under rule 51A(2) of the Trade Marks Rules.

subsection.leadIn: If the person who made the original application wishes to commence proceedings before the Court in relation to the original application, the person must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the specified period, take out an originating summons in Form No. 10 or 11 in Appendix A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons, serve a copy of the originating summons on the Registrar of Trade Marks.

subsection.content: Proceedings commenced under paragraph (2) in relation to an original application are to be treated as the continuation of the original application.

As soon as practicable after being served with a copy of the originating summons, the Registrar of Trade Marks must, for the purpose of the proceedings commenced under paragraph (2), file with the Court any document or other thing that was filed with the Registrar of Trade Marks for the purpose of the original application.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: specified period (指明限期) means—(a)a period of 1 month after the date of the notice of decision given under rule 51A(2) of the Trade Marks Rules; or(b)such period as may be extended by the Registrar of Trade Marks under rule 94(1) of the Trade Marks Rules.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Service of documents on owners of registered trade marks (O. 100, r. 7)

subsection.content: This rule applies to the service of a document on the owner of a registered trade mark in any proceedings relating to the trade mark before the owner has provided an address for service in an acknowledgement of service under Order 12, rule 3(2).

subsection.leadIn: For the service of an originating process, or any other document that is required to be or may be served in accordance with Order 10, on the owner of a registered trade mark—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Order 10 has effect as if in rule 1(2) of that Order—

subparagraph.content: the reference to service on a defendant were a reference to service on the owner; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the reference to the usual or last known address of the defendant were a reference—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to the usual or last known address of the owner; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to the owner’s address for service as shown in the register in relation to the trade mark; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Order 65 has effect as if, in rule 3(2) of that Order, the reference to Order 10, rule 1(2) were a reference to that rule 1(2) as construed in accordance with subparagraph (a).

subsection.content: For the service of a document other than those mentioned in paragraph (2) on the owner of a registered trade mark, Order 65 has effect as if the addresses specified in rule 5(2)(a), (b), (c) and (d) of that Order included the owner’s address for service as shown in the register in relation to the trade mark.

A document served on the owner of a registered trade mark at the owner’s address for service as shown in the register in relation to the trade mark in accordance with this rule is treated as having been duly served within the jurisdiction on the owner even if the owner is not within the jurisdiction on the date of service mentioned in Order 10, rule 1(3)(a).

section.name: s8
section.heading: Filing of orders etc. with Registrar of Trade Marks (O. 100, r. 8)
section.content: If the Court has made an order or a declaration, or has granted a certificate, under the Ordinance in favour of a person, the person or, if there is more than one such person, the person directed by the Court, must file a sealed copy of the order, declaration or certificate with the Registrar of Trade Marks within 14 days after the date of sealing the order, declaration or certificate.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Transitional (O. 100, r. 9)
section.content: For proceedings that are brought under the Ordinance but are pending before the Court immediately before the commencement date* of the Rules of the High Court (Amendment) (No. 2) Rules 2025 (new rules), the Court may, of its own motion or on application of a party to the proceedings, give directions that the new rules, or any part of it, are to be applied to the further conduct of the proceedings.

section.name: s102
section.heading: The Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) and The Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Applications to be made by originating summons (O. 102, r. 2)

subsection.content: Except in the case of applications made in proceedings relating to the winding up of companies, applications made pursuant to section 724 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) and the applications mentioned in rule 5, every application under that Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) may be made by originating summons. (L.N. 152 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: An originating summons under this rule shall be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A unless the application made by the summons is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application under section 675 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for an order to make provision for all or any of the matters mentioned in subsection (2) of that section where an order sanctioning the compromise or arrangement to which the application relates has previously been made, or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application under section 302 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) for an order directing a receiver or manager of a company to make good any such default as is mentioned in subsection (1) of that section, or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application under section 306 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) or section 898 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for an order directing a company and any officer thereof to make good any such default as is mentioned in that section.

subsection.content: An application under section 733 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for leave to dispense with the service of a written notice required by that section may be made by ex parte originating summons. (L.N. 80 of 2005)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Applications to be made by petition (O. 102, r. 5)

subsection.leadIn: The following applications must be made by petition, namely applications— (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 89(5) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to cancel the alteration of a private company’s objects, (28 of 2003 s. 120)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under section 90(4) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to cancel the alteration of a provision contained in the articles of association of a relevant company as defined by section 90(10) of that Ordinance, (28 of 2003 s. 120)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: under section 226 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to confirm a reduction of the share capital of a company,

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: under section 182 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to disallow any variation or abrogation of the rights attached to shares in any class of shares in a company,

paragraph.name: ga
paragraph.content: under section 190 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to disallow any variation or abrogation of the rights of any class of members of a company that does not have a share capital, (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: under section 673 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to sanction a compromise or arrangement between a company and its creditors or any class of them or between a company and its members or any class of them,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: under section 765 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for the restoration of a company to the Companies Register, where the application is made in conjunction with an application for the winding up of the company,

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: under section 817 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to cancel the alteration of the form of a company’s constitution, and

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: under section 904 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for relief from liability of an officer of a company or a person employed by a company as auditor. (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Entitlement of proceedings (O. 102, r. 6)

subsection.content: Every originating summons and petition by which any such proceedings are begun and all affidavits, notices and other documents in those proceedings must be entitled in the matter of the company in question and in the matter of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32). (L.N. 152 of 2008; 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Case management summons (O. 102, r. 7)

subsection.content: After presentation of a petition by which any such application as is mentioned in rule 5 is made, the petitioner, except where his application is one of those mentioned in paragraph (2), must take out a case management summons under this rule. (L.N. 152 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: The applications referred to in paragraph (1) are—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application under section 673 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to sanction an arrangement or compromise (except where the petition for such sanction includes an application for an order under section 675 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)), and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application under section 765 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for the restoration of a company to the Companies Register. (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.content: On the hearing of the summons the Court may by order give such directions as to the proceedings to be taken before the hearing of the petition as it thinks fit including, in particular, directions for the publication of notices and the making of any inquiry.

subsection.leadIn: Where the application made by the petition is to confirm a reduction of the share capital of a company, then, without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (3), the Court may give directions— (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an inquiry to be made as to the debts of, and claims against, the company or as to any class or classes of such debts or claims;

paragraph.name: b

subsection.continued: and the power of the Court under section 226(3) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to direct that section 227 of that Ordinance shall not apply as regards any class or classes of creditors may be exercised on any hearing of the summons. (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.content: Rules 8 to 13 shall have effect subject to any directions given by the Court under this rule.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Inquiry as to debts: company to make list of creditors (O. 102, r. 8)

subsection.leadIn: Where under rule 7 the Court orders such an inquiry as is mentioned in paragraph (4) thereof, the company in question must, within 7 days after the making of the order, file in the Registry an affidavit made by an officer of the company competent to make it verifying a list containing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of every creditor entitled to any debt or claim to which the inquiry extends,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount due to each creditor in respect of such debt or claim or, in the case of a debt or claim which is subject to any contingency or sounds only in damages or for some other reason does not bear a certain value, a just estimate of the value thereof, and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the total of those amounts and values.

subsection.content: The deponent must state in the affidavit his belief that at the date fixed by the Court as the date by reference to which the list is to be made there is no debt or claim which, if that date were the commencement of the winding up of the company, would be admissible in proof against the company, other than the debts or claims set out in the list and any debts or claims to which the inquiry does not extend, and must also state his means of knowledge of the matters deposed to.
The list must be left at the office mentioned in paragraph (1) not later than one day after the affidavit is filed.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Inspection of list of creditors (O. 102, r. 9)

subsection.content: Copies of the list made under rule 8 with the omission, unless the Court otherwise directs, of the amount due to each creditor and the estimated value of any debt or claim to which any creditor is entitled, shall be kept at the registered office of the company and at the office of that company’s solicitor.
Any person shall be entitled during ordinary business hours, on payment of a fee of one dollar, to inspect the said list at any such office and to take extracts therefrom.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Notice to creditors (O. 102, r. 10)
section.leadIn: Within 7 days after filing the affidavit required by rule 8 the company must send by post to each creditor named in the list exhibited to the affidavit, at his last known address, a notice stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the reduction sought to be confirmed,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the effect of the order directing an inquiry as to debts and claims,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount or value specified in the list as due or estimated to be due to that creditor, and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the time fixed by the Court within which, if he claims to be entitled to a larger amount, he must send particulars of his debt or claim and the name and address of his solicitor, if any, to the company’s solicitor.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Advertisement of petition and list of creditors (O. 102, r. 11)
section.leadIn: After filing the affidavit required by rule 8 the company must insert, in such newspapers and at such times as the Court directs, a notice stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of presentation of the petition and the amount of the reduction thereby sought to be confirmed,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the inquiry ordered by the Court under rule 7,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the places where the list of creditors may be inspected in accordance with rule 9, and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the time within which any creditor not named in the list who claims to be entitled to any debt or claim to which the inquiry extends must send his name and address, the name and address of his solicitor, if any, and particulars of his debt or claim to the company’s solicitor.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Affidavit as to claims made by creditors (O. 102, r. 12)
section.leadIn: Within such time as the Court directs the company must file in the Registry an affidavit made by the company’s solicitor and an officer of the company competent to make it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proving service of the notices mentioned in rule 10 and advertisement of the notice mentioned in rule 11,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: verifying a list containing the names and addresses of the persons (if any) who in pursuance of such notices sent in particulars of debts or claims, specifying the amount of each debt or claim,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: distinguishing in such list those debts or claims which are wholly, or as to any and what part thereof, admitted by the company, disputed by the company or alleged by the company to be outside the scope of the inquiry, and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: stating which of the persons named in the list made under rule 8, and which of the persons named in the list made under this rule, have been paid or consent to the reduction sought to be confirmed.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Adjudication of disputed claims (O. 102, r. 13)
section.leadIn: If the company contends that a person is not entitled to be entered in the list of creditors in respect of any debt or claim or in respect of the full amount claimed by him in respect of any debt or claim, then, unless the company is willing to secure payment of that debt or claim by appropriating the full amount of the debt or claim, the company must, if the Court so directs, send to that person by post at his last known address a notice requiring him—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within such time as may be specified in the notice, being not less than 4 clear days after service thereof, to file an affidavit proving his debt or claim or, as the case may be, so much thereof as is not admitted by the company, and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to attend the adjudication of his debt or claim at the place and time specified in the notice, being the time appointed by the Court for the adjudication of debts and claims.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Certifying lists of creditors entitled to object to reduction (O. 102, r. 14)
section.leadIn: The list of creditors entitled to object to such reduction as is mentioned in rule 7(4), as settled by the Court under section 227 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) shall be certified and filed by the Registrar and his certificate shall— (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the debts or claims (if any) disallowed by the Court; (L.N. 122 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: distinguish the debts or claims (if any) the full amount of which is admitted by the company, the debts or claims (if any) the full amount of which, though not admitted by the company, the company is willing to appropriate, the debts or claims (if any) the amount of which has been fixed by adjudication of the Court under section 227 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) and other debts or claims; (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the total amount of the debts or claims payment of which has been secured by appropriation under section 227 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: show which creditors consent to the reduction and the total amount of their debts or claims;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: specify the creditors who sought to prove their debts or claims under rule 13 and state which of such debts or claims were allowed.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Evidence of consent of creditor (O. 102, r. 15)
section.content: The consent of a creditor to such reduction as is mentioned in rule 7(4) may be proved in such manner as the Court thinks sufficient.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Time, etc. of hearing of petition for confirmation of reduction (O. 102, r. 16)

subsection.content: A petition for the confirmation of any such reduction as is mentioned in rule 7(4) shall not, where the Court has directed an inquiry pursuant to that rule, be heard before the expiration of at least 8 clear days after the filing of the certificate mentioned in rule 14.
Before the hearing of such a petition, a notice specifying the day appointed for the hearing must be published at such times and in such newspapers as the Court may direct.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Patents Ordinance (Cap. 514)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation (O. 103, r. 1)

subsection.leadIn: In this Order—
subsection.def: Court (法院) means the Court of First Instance;

filing date of the patent application (專利申請提交日期) means—(a)for a standard patent (R), the deemed date of filing of the application for the patent, within the meaning of section 38;(b)for a standard patent (O) or a short-term patent, the date of filing of the application for the patent;
the Ordinance (《條例》) means the Patents Ordinance (Cap. 514);
the Patents Rules (《專利規則》) means the Patents (General) Rules (Cap. 514 sub. leg. C).

subsection.content: In this Order, a section referred to by number means the section so numbered in the Ordinance.
Expressions used in this Order that are used in the Ordinance have the same meaning in this Order as in the Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application (O. 103, r. 2)
section.content: These rules apply to proceedings brought before the Court under or for the purposes of the Ordinance subject to the provisions of this Order.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Proceedings to be begun by originating summons (O. 103, r. 3)

subsection.content: Proceedings under a provision of the Ordinance specified in column (A) of the Table, which relates to a matter the general description of which is set out in column (B) of the Table opposite to that provision, must be begun by originating summons in Form No. 8, 10 or 11 in Appendix A.

td.p: General description of matter to be brought before the Court
Question as to whether a person is entitled under section 12 to apply for grant of standard patent (R) for invention.
Question as to whether any right in or under an application for standard patent (R) should be transferred or granted to any other person.

Question as to whether a person is entitled to be granted a licence or whether the period or terms of the licence are reasonable following an order for transfer of application for standard patent (R).
Question as to whether a person is entitled to apply for grant of standard patent (O) for invention.
Question as to whether any right in or under an application for standard patent (O) should be transferred or granted to any other person.

Question as to whether a person is entitled to be granted a licence or whether the period or terms of the licence are reasonable following an order for transfer of application for standard patent (O).
Application to amend specification of patent.
Question of proprietorship of patent after it has been granted.
Question as to whether a person is entitled to be granted a licence or whether the period or terms of the licence are reasonable following a transfer of patent under section 55.
Application for variation, discharge, etc., of order for compensation made under section 58.
Application for variation of terms or conditions of certain contracts or licences.
Application for compulsory licence under standard patent.
Application for variation or cancellation of compulsory licence.
Application for determination of amount of remuneration payable under section 72E(2).
Application for payment of remuneration under section 72E(2).
Application for review of grant of import compulsory licence, terms or conditions of the licence, apportionment of the amount of remuneration or termination of the licence.
Application for termination of import compulsory licence by proprietor of patent.
Application for review of grant of export compulsory licence, terms or conditions of the licence or termination of the licence.
Application for termination of export compulsory licence by proprietor of patent.

subsection.content: Paragraph (1) does not apply to a matter to be brought before the Court in proceedings that are pending before it.
Proceedings mentioned in rule 25(2) must be begun by originating summons in Form No. 10 or 11 in Appendix A.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Supplementary provisions relating to originating summons (O. 103, r. 4)

subsection.leadIn: An originating summons by which any proceedings under or for the purposes of the Ordinance are begun must, in addition to any other information required to be included by other provisions of this Order, include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a concise statement setting out the nature of the question referred to, or of the matter brought before, the Court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a summary of the facts, laws and nature of the evidence on which the person who takes out the originating summons relies in support of the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the order or relief sought.

subsection.content: Except as otherwise provided in this Order, Order 10 applies to the service of a copy of an originating summons required to be served under this Order as Order 10 applies to the service of an originating process.

crossHeading.b: III. Who may Apply for Standard Patent

section.name: s5
section.heading: Reference under section 13(1) or 37H(1) (determination before grant as to who may apply) (O. 103, r. 5)

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings in which a question is referred to the Court under section 13(1)(a) or 37H(1)(a), the plaintiff or applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the originating summons by which the proceedings are begun on the Registrar of Patents within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice of the proceedings to each of the persons mentioned in paragraph (2) at the person’s usual or last known address—

subparagraph.content: for inter-partes proceedings—at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant; or
for ex-parte proceedings—within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every other person whom the plaintiff or applicant alleges is entitled to apply for a standard patent for the invention to which the proceedings relate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every person whom the plaintiff or applicant believes to be the inventor or joint inventor of the invention.

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings in which a question is referred to the Court under section 13(1)(b) or 37H(1)(b), the plaintiff or applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the originating summons by which the proceedings are begun on the Registrar of Patents within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice of the proceedings to each of the persons mentioned in paragraph (4) at the person’s usual or last known address—

subparagraph.content: for inter-partes proceedings—at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant; or
for ex-parte proceedings—within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: every person whom the plaintiff or applicant alleges any right in or under the application for a standard patent should be transferred or granted; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every person whom the plaintiff or applicant believes to be the inventor or joint inventor of the invention.

subsection.leadIn: If an application for a standard patent for the invention has been made and published at the time when the originating summons is issued, the plaintiff or applicant must give a written notice of the proceedings to every person who is shown in the register as having a right in or under the application at the person’s usual or last known address—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for inter-partes proceedings—at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for ex-parte proceedings—within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons.

subsection.leadIn: If an application for a standard patent for the invention has been made but has not been published at the time when the originating summons is issued, the plaintiff or applicant must give a written notice of the proceedings to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every applicant of the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every person who has a right in or under the application as shown in an application, or a notice, that is mentioned in section 46(1) of the Patents Rules.

subsection.leadIn: A written notice required to be given to a person under paragraph (6)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be given to the person—

subparagraph.content: for inter-partes proceedings—at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant; or
for ex-parte proceedings—within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be given to the person at the following address—

subparagraph.content: for a person mentioned in paragraph (6)(a)—the person’s address for service communicated to the plaintiff or applicant under section 91A(3) of the Patents Rules; and
for a person mentioned in paragraph (6)(b)—the person’s address communicated to the plaintiff or applicant under that section.

subsection.content: Paragraph (1)(b), (3)(b), (5) or (6) does not require a written notice to be given to a person who is a party to the proceedings.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Reference under section 14(5) or 37K(7) (right to be granted licence etc.) (O. 103, r. 6)

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings in which a question is referred to the Court under section 14(5) or 37K(7), the plaintiff must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the originating summons by which the proceedings are begun on the Registrar of Patents within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice of the proceedings to each of the following persons at the person’s usual or last known address at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant—

subparagraph.content: a person in whose name the application for a patent is to proceed;
a person who, to the plaintiff’s knowledge, claims to be entitled to be granted a licence under section 14(3) or 37K(3) or (4) (as the case requires).

subsection.content: Paragraph (1)(b) does not require a written notice to be given to a person who is a party to the proceedings.

crossHeading.b: IV. Provisions on Patents after Grant

section.name: s7
section.heading: Application under section 46(2) (application to amend specification of patent after grant) (O. 103, r. 7)

subsection.content: This rule applies to an application to the Court under section 46(2) to amend the specification of a patent.

subsection.leadIn: The proprietor of a patent who wishes to make an application under section 46(2) (intending applicant) must publish in the Gazette an advertisement (specified advertisement) that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identifies the patent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: states that on the intending applicant being given prior notice, the full particulars of the amendment that the intending applicant intends to seek in the application are available for inspection within 28 days after publication of the specified advertisement during ordinary business hours at a place in Hong Kong designated by the intending applicant;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: sets out the intending applicant’s address for service in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: sets out the matters provided for in paragraph (3); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: sets out the fact that, subject to paragraph (8), the person who sends a notice under paragraph (3) will be named as a defendant in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: If a person intends to oppose the application, the person must, within 42 days after publication of the specified advertisement, send a notice by registered post to the intending applicant at the intending applicant’s address for service set out in the specified advertisement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating an intention to oppose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the person’s address for service in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The proceedings must be commenced within 28 days (relevant period) after the expiry of the period specified in paragraph (3).
The relevant period is not extendable.

subsection.leadIn: However, if the intending applicant fails to commence the proceedings within the relevant period, the intending applicant—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must, within 3 days after the publication under subparagraph (a), send a copy of the new advertisement by registered post to the person who has sent a notice of intention to oppose under paragraph (3) at the person’s address for service specified in the notice,

subsection.continued: and paragraphs (3), (4) and (5) have effect in relation to the publication of the new advertisement under subparagraph (a) in the same manner as they have effect in relation to the publication of the specified advertisement under paragraph (2).

subsection.content: If a notice has been sent under paragraph (3) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) or to the new advertisement published under paragraph (6)(a), the intending applicant is to be the plaintiff and, subject to paragraph (8), the person who sent the notice is to be named as a defendant in the originating summons by which the inter-partes proceedings are begun.

If a person has sent a notice under paragraph (3) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) but fails to send a fresh notice in accordance with paragraph (3) in response to the new advertisement published under paragraph (6)(a), the intending applicant need not name the person as a defendant in the proceedings.

If no notice has been sent under paragraph (3) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) or to the new advertisement published under paragraph (6)(a), the intending applicant is to be the applicant in the originating summons by which the ex-parte proceedings are begun.
The originating summons must be accompanied by a copy of the specification of the patent showing in coloured ink the amendment sought.
The plaintiff or the applicant must, within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons, serve on the Registrar of Patents a copy of the originating summons.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court makes an order allowing the specification of a patent to be amended, the plaintiff or the applicant must, within 14 days after the date of sealing the order, file with the Registrar of Patents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sealed copy of the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (13), a new specification as amended, which must be prepared in accordance with—

subparagraph.content: section 12 of the Patents Rules if the patent is a standard patent (R);
section 31Q of the Patents Rules if the patent is a standard patent (O); or
section 62 of the Patents Rules if the patent is a short-term patent.

subsection.content: The Court may order that the filing of a copy of the specification with the amendment marked on it is sufficient compliance with the requirement under paragraph (12)(b).
The Registrar of Patents must cause a copy of the order to be published at least once in the official journal.

crossHeading.b: V. Property in Patents and Applications; Registration

section.name: s8
section.heading: Application for purposes of section 53(1) (application for rectification of register) (O. 103, r. 8)

subsection.content: In any proceedings relating to an application for the purposes of section 53(1), the applicant must, within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons by which the proceedings are begun, serve on the Registrar of Patents a copy of the originating summons.

If an application for the purposes of section 53(1) is made by way of counterclaim in patent infringement proceedings that are pending before the Court, the applicant must, at the same time of filing the counterclaim, serve a copy of the counterclaim on the Registrar of Patents.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Reference under section 55(1) (determination of right to patent after grant) (O. 103, r. 9)

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings in which a question is referred to the Court under section 55(1), the plaintiff must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the originating summons by which the proceedings are begun on the Registrar of Patents within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice of the proceedings to the following persons at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant—

subparagraph.content: every person registered as the proprietor of the patent concerned or as having a right in or under the patent;
every person who is alleged in the originating summons to be entitled to a right in or under the patent.

subsection.leadIn: A written notice required to be given to a person under paragraph (1)(b) must be given to the person at the following address—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a person mentioned in paragraph (1)(b)(i)—the person’s address for service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a person mentioned in paragraph (1)(b)(ii)—the person’s usual or last known address.

subsection.content: Paragraph (1)(b) does not require a written notice to be given to a person who is a party to the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: address for service (供送達地址), in relation to a person registered as the proprietor of a patent, means the person’s address for service as shown in the register in relation to the patent.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Reference under section 56(5) (right to be granted licence etc. after transfer under section 55) (O. 103, r. 10)

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings in which a question is referred to the Court under section 56(5), the plaintiff must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the originating summons by which the proceedings are begun on the Registrar of Patents within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice of the proceedings to the following persons at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant—

subparagraph.content: every new proprietor of the patent concerned;
every person who, to the plaintiff’s knowledge, claims to be entitled to be granted a licence under section 56(3) or (3A) to continue working or to work the invention concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A written notice required to be given to a person under paragraph (1)(b) must be given to the person at the following address—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a person mentioned in paragraph (1)(b)(i)—the person’s address for service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a person mentioned in paragraph (1)(b)(ii)—the person’s usual or last known address.

subsection.content: Paragraph (1)(b) does not require a written notice to be given to a person who is a party to the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: address for service (供送達地址), in relation to a person registered as the proprietor of a patent, means the person’s address for service as shown in the register in relation to the patent.

crossHeading.b: VI. Compulsory Licences for Standard Patents

section.name: s11
section.heading: Application under section 64(1) (grant of compulsory licence) or 66(3) (variation etc. of compulsory licence) (O. 103, r. 11)

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application to the Court under section 64(1) for a licence under a standard patent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application to the Court under section 66(3) for an order for the variation or cancellation of a licence granted under an order made under section 64 or 65.

subsection.leadIn: A person who wishes to make an application under section 64(1) or 66(3) (intending plaintiff) must publish in the Gazette an advertisement (specified advertisement) that sets out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars of the order that the intending plaintiff intends to seek in the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the intending plaintiff’s address for service in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the matters provided for in paragraph (4); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the fact that, subject to paragraph (9), the person who sends a notice under paragraph (4) will be named as a defendant in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: The intending plaintiff must, within 3 days from the date of publication of the specified advertisement, send a copy of the specified advertisement to the following persons by registered post at their addresses for service as shown in the register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every other person who is registered as the proprietor of the patent concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every other person who is shown in the register as having a right in or under the patent.

subsection.leadIn: If a person intends to oppose the application, the person must, within 28 days after publication of the specified advertisement, send a notice by registered post to the intending plaintiff at the intending plaintiff’s address for service set out in the specified advertisement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating an intention to oppose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the person’s address for service in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The proceedings must be commenced within 28 days (relevant period) after the expiry of the period specified in paragraph (4).
The relevant period is not extendable.

subsection.leadIn: However, if the intending plaintiff fails to commence the proceedings within the relevant period, the intending plaintiff—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must, within 3 days after the publication under subparagraph (a), send a copy of the new advertisement by registered post to the person who has sent a notice of intention to oppose under paragraph (4) at the person’s address for service specified in the notice,

subsection.continued: and paragraphs (4), (5) and (6) have effect in relation to the publication of the new advertisement under subparagraph (a) in the same manner as they have effect in relation to the publication of the specified advertisement under paragraph (2).

subsection.content: Subject to paragraph (9), the person who sent a notice under paragraph (4) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) or to the new advertisement published under paragraph (7)(a) is to be named as a defendant in the originating summons by which the inter-partes proceedings are begun.

If a person has sent a notice under paragraph (4) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) but fails to send a fresh notice in accordance with paragraph (4) in response to the new advertisement published under paragraph (7)(a), the intending plaintiff need not name the person as a defendant in the proceedings.

crossHeading.b: VII. Import Compulsory Licences for Patented Pharmaceutical Products

section.name: s12
section.heading: Application under section 72J(2) (order for payment of remuneration) (O. 103, r. 12)

subsection.content: This rule applies to proceedings relating to an application to the Court under section 72J(2) for an order for payment of remuneration under section 72E(2).
The plaintiff must, within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons by which the proceedings are begun, serve on the Director of Health a copy of the originating summons.
In the proceedings, the Director of Health is entitled to appear before the Court or be represented and be heard, and must appear before the Court if so directed by the Court.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Application under section 72J(6) (review of grant of import compulsory licence, its terms or conditions, termination, etc.) (O. 103, r. 13)

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies to proceedings relating to an application to the Court under section 72J(6) for a review of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grant of an import compulsory licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the terms or conditions of an import compulsory licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the apportionment of the amount of remuneration; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the termination of an import compulsory licence.

subsection.content: The plaintiff must, within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons by which the proceedings are begun, serve on the Director of Health a copy of the originating summons.

If the application is for a review of a matter mentioned in paragraph (1)(a), (b) or (d), the plaintiff must give a written notice of the proceedings to the import compulsory licensee concerned (if not a party to the proceedings) at the licensee’s usual or last known address at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant.

If the application is for a review of the apportionment of the amount of remuneration, the plaintiff must give a written notice of the proceedings to every proprietor of the patent concerned (if not a party to the proceedings) at the proprietor’s address for service at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant.
In the proceedings, the Director of Health is entitled to appear before the Court or be represented and be heard, and must appear before the Court if so directed by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: address for service (供送達地址), in relation to a person registered as the proprietor of a patent, means the person’s address for service as shown in the register in relation to the patent.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Application under section 72J(8) (application by proprietor of patent for termination of import compulsory licence) (O. 103, r. 14)

subsection.content: This rule applies to an application by the proprietor of a patent to the Court under section 72J(8) for an order to terminate an import compulsory licence.

subsection.leadIn: The proprietor of a patent who wishes to make an application under section 72J(8) (intending plaintiff) must publish in the Gazette an advertisement (specified advertisement) that sets out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars of the order that the intending plaintiff intends to seek in the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the intending plaintiff’s address for service in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the matters provided for in paragraph (3); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the fact that, subject to paragraph (8), the person who sends a notice under paragraph (3) will be named as a defendant in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: If a person intends to oppose the application, the person must, within 28 days after publication of the specified advertisement, send a notice by registered post to the intending plaintiff at the intending plaintiff’s address for service set out in the specified advertisement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating an intention to oppose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the person’s address for service in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The proceedings must be commenced within 28 days (relevant period) after the expiry of the period specified in paragraph (3).
The relevant period is not extendable.

subsection.leadIn: However, if the intending plaintiff fails to commence the proceedings within the relevant period, the intending plaintiff—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must, within 3 days after the publication under subparagraph (a), send a copy of the new advertisement by registered post to the person who has sent a notice of intention to oppose under paragraph (3) at the person’s address for service specified in the notice,

subsection.continued: and paragraphs (3), (4) and (5) have effect in relation to the publication of the new advertisement under subparagraph (a) in the same manner as they have effect in relation to the publication of the specified advertisement under paragraph (2).

subsection.content: Subject to paragraph (8), the person who sent a notice under paragraph (3) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) or to the new advertisement published under paragraph (6)(a) is to be named as a defendant in the originating summons by which the inter-partes proceedings are begun.

If a person has sent a notice under paragraph (3) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) but fails to send a fresh notice in accordance with paragraph (3) in response to the new advertisement published under paragraph (6)(a), the intending plaintiff need not name the person as a defendant in the proceedings.
The plaintiff must, within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons, serve on the Director of Health a copy of the originating summons.
In the proceedings, the Director of Health is entitled to appear before the Court or be represented and be heard, and must appear before the Court if so directed by the Court.

crossHeading.b: VIII. Export Compulsory Licences for Patented Pharmaceutical Products

section.name: s15
section.heading: Application under section 72R(1) (review of grant of export compulsory licence, its terms or conditions or termination) (O. 103, r. 15)

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies to proceedings relating to an application to the Court under section 72R(1) for a review of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grant of an export compulsory licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the terms or conditions of an export compulsory licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the termination of an export compulsory licence.

subsection.content: The plaintiff must, within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons by which the proceedings are begun, serve on the Director of Health a copy of the originating summons.

The plaintiff must give a written notice of the proceedings to the export compulsory licensee concerned (if not a party to the proceedings) at the licensee’s usual or last known address at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant.
In the proceedings, the Director of Health is entitled to appear before the Court or be represented and be heard, and must appear before the Court if so directed by the Court.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Application under section 72R(5) (application by proprietor of patent for termination of export compulsory licence) (O. 103, r. 16)

subsection.content: This rule applies to an application by the proprietor of a patent to the Court under section 72R(5) for an order to terminate an export compulsory licence.

subsection.leadIn: The proprietor of a patent who wishes to make an application under section 72R(5) (intending plaintiff) must publish in the Gazette an advertisement (specified advertisement) that sets out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars of the order that the intending plaintiff intends to seek in the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the intending plaintiff’s address for service in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the matters provided for in paragraph (3); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the fact that, subject to paragraph (8), the person who sends a notice under paragraph (3) will be named as a defendant in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: If a person intends to oppose the application, the person must, within 28 days after publication of the specified advertisement, send a notice by registered post to the intending plaintiff at the intending plaintiff’s address for service set out in the specified advertisement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating an intention to oppose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the person’s address for service in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The proceedings must be commenced within 28 days (relevant period) after the expiry of the period specified in paragraph (3).
The relevant period is not extendable.

subsection.leadIn: However, if the intending plaintiff fails to commence the proceedings within the relevant period, the intending plaintiff—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must, within 3 days after the publication under subparagraph (a), send a copy of the new advertisement by registered post to the person who has sent a notice of intention to oppose under paragraph (3) at the person’s address for service specified in the notice,

subsection.continued: and paragraphs (3), (4) and (5) have effect in relation to the publication of the new advertisement under subparagraph (a) in the same manner as they have effect in relation to the publication of the specified advertisement under paragraph (2).

subsection.content: Subject to paragraph (8), the person who sent a notice under paragraph (3) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) or to the new advertisement published under paragraph (6)(a) is to be named as a defendant in the originating summons by which the inter-partes proceedings are begun.

If a person has sent a notice under paragraph (3) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) but fails to send a fresh notice in accordance with paragraph (3) in response to the new advertisement published under paragraph (6)(a), the intending plaintiff need not name the person as a defendant in the proceedings.
The plaintiff must, within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons, serve on the Director of Health a copy of the originating summons.
In the proceedings, the Director of Health is entitled to appear before the Court or be represented and be heard, and must appear before the Court if so directed by the Court.

crossHeading.b: IX. Infringement, Revocation and Putting Validity in Issue

section.name: s17
section.heading: Patent infringement proceedings (O. 103, r. 17)

subsection.content: This rule applies to patent infringement proceedings if they are begun by writ.

A party to the proceedings who alleges any infringements of a patent in the party’s pleading must include in the pleading particulars of the infringements on which the party relies in support of the alleged infringement.

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings under section 80, the particulars of the infringements must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify which of the claims in the specification of the patent are alleged to have been infringed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give at least 1 instance of each type of infringement alleged.

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings under section 88, the particulars of the infringements must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify which of the claims in the specification of the patent and which of the claims in the specification of the published request to record or the published patent application are alleged to have been infringed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give at least 1 instance of each type of infringement alleged.

subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (6) applies if a party to the proceedings (relevant party) alleges, as a defence to the infringement alleged by the proprietor or exclusive licensee of the patent concerned, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the alleged infringement, there was in force—

subparagraph.content: a contract relating to the patent made by or with the consent of the proprietor or exclusive licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contract or the licence contains a condition or term that is void because of section 62.

subsection.leadIn: The relevant party must include in the party’s pleading—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: particulars of the date of, and parties to, the contract or licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of the void condition or term.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Groundless threats of infringement proceedings (O. 103, r. 18)

subsection.content: This rule applies to proceedings under section 89 if they are begun by writ regarding a threat to bring patent infringement proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (3) applies if a party to the proceedings alleges in the party’s pleading that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the alleged infringement, there was in force—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contract or the licence contains a condition or term that is void because of section 62.

subsection.leadIn: The party must include in the party’s pleading—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: particulars of the date of, and parties to, the contract or licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of the void condition or term.

subsection.content: A party to the proceedings who relies on section 89A(1)(a), (2)(a) or (4)(a) in the party’s pleading must include in the pleading the particulars of the infringement on which the party relies in support of the pleading.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars of the infringement must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: specify which of the claims in the specification of the patent are alleged to have been infringed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: give at least 1 instance of each type of infringement alleged, if the acts have been done.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Application for revocation under section 91(1)(a) (on ground of contrary to public order (“ordre public”) or morality) (O. 103, r. 19)

subsection.content: This rule applies to an application to the Court for an order to revoke a patent for an invention on the ground that the invention is not a patentable invention by reason of a matter specified in section 9A(5).

subsection.leadIn: A person who wishes to make an application for the purposes of section 91(1)(a) (intending plaintiff) must publish in the Gazette an advertisement (specified advertisement) that sets out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars of the order that the intending plaintiff intends to seek in the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: brief particulars of the ground on which the intending plaintiff relies in support of the application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the intending plaintiff’s address for service in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the matters provided for in paragraph (3); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the fact that, subject to paragraph (8), the person who sends a notice under paragraph (3) will be named as a defendant in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: If a person intends to oppose the application, the person must, within 28 days after publication of the specified advertisement, send a notice by registered post to the intending plaintiff at the intending plaintiff’s address for service set out in the specified advertisement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating an intention to oppose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the person’s address for service in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The proceedings must be commenced within 28 days (relevant period) after the expiry of the period specified in paragraph (3).
The relevant period is not extendable.

subsection.leadIn: However, if the intending plaintiff fails to commence the proceedings within the relevant period, the intending plaintiff—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must, within 3 days after the publication under subparagraph (a), send a copy of the new advertisement by registered post to the person who has sent a notice of intention to oppose under paragraph (3) at the person’s address for service specified in the notice,

subsection.continued: and paragraphs (3), (4) and (5) have effect in relation to the publication of the new advertisement under subparagraph (a) in the same manner as they have effect in relation to the publication of the specified advertisement under paragraph (2).

subsection.content: Subject to paragraph (8), the person who sent a notice under paragraph (3) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) or to the new advertisement published under paragraph (6)(a) is, in addition to the proprietor of the patent, to be named as a defendant in the originating summons by which the inter-partes proceedings are begun.

If a person has sent a notice under paragraph (3) in response to the specified advertisement published under paragraph (2) but fails to send a fresh notice in accordance with paragraph (3) in response to the new advertisement published under paragraph (6)(a), the intending plaintiff need not name the person as a defendant in the proceedings.
The plaintiff must, within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons, serve on the Registrar of Patents a copy of the originating summons.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Proceedings in which validity of patent is put in issue (O. 103, r. 20)

subsection.content: This rule applies to proceedings in which the validity of a patent is put in issue as described in section 101(1).

subsection.leadIn: A party to the proceedings who puts the validity of a patent in issue must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: include particulars of the objections to the validity of the patent concerned in support of the party’s allegation of invalidity—

subparagraph.content: in the originating summons or in the party’s affidavit evidence (if the proceedings are begun by originating summons); or
in the party’s pleading (if the proceedings are begun by writ); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: serve on the Registrar of Patents (whichever of the following has the particulars included under subparagraph (a))—

subparagraph.content: within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons, a copy of the originating summons;
at the same time of filing the affidavit evidence, a copy of the affidavit evidence; or
at the same time of filing the pleading, a copy of the pleading.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars of the objections mentioned in paragraph (2)(a) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the grounds on which the validity of the patent is put in issue; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include particulars that clearly define every issue that the party to the proceedings intends to raise.

subsection.leadIn: If the validity of a patent is put in issue on the ground that the invention is not a patentable invention because it is not new or does not involve an inventive step, the particulars of the objections must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the manner, time and place of the prior publication or the prior user relied on to support that ground; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if prior user is alleged—

subparagraph.content: specify the name of every person alleged to have made such user;

state whether such user is alleged to have continued until the filing date of the patent application or, if priority is claimed, the earliest priority date of the claim in question or of the invention (as may be appropriate) and, if not, the earliest and latest date on which such user is alleged to have taken place;
contain a description accompanied by drawings, if necessary, that is sufficient to identify such user; and
if such user relates to machinery or apparatus, state whether the machinery or apparatus is in existence and where it can be inspected.

subsection.leadIn: If the validity of a patent is put in issue on the ground that the invention is not a patentable invention because it does not involve an inventive step, a party to the proceedings who intends to establish that the invention involves an inventive step by relying on the commercial success of the patent must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the proceedings are begun by writ—state the facts of the commercial success in the party’s pleading; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the proceedings are begun by originating summons—state the facts of the commercial success and provide the relevant evidence in the party’s affidavit evidence.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Restrictions on admission of evidence of user of machinery or apparatus (O. 103, r. 21)

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings relating to a patent, if a party alleges that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any machinery or apparatus has been used before the filing date of the patent application or priority date mentioned in rule 20(4)(b)(ii); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the machinery or apparatus is in existence at the date of service of the particulars of the objections mentioned in rule 20(2)(a),

subsection.continued: evidence of the user of the machinery or apparatus before that filing date of the patent application or priority date is not admissible unless the matters mentioned in paragraph (2) are proved.

subsection.leadIn: The matters are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the machinery or apparatus is in the party’s possession—the party offered inspection of the machinery or apparatus to the other parties to the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the machinery or apparatus is not in the party’s possession—the party used all reasonable endeavours to obtain inspection of the machinery or apparatus for the other parties to the proceedings.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Discovery of documents (O. 103, r. 22)

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies to the following proceedings if they are begun by writ—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: patent infringement proceedings (whether or not relief in relation to any other matter is claimed);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceedings under section 89;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: proceedings in which a declaration in relation to a patent is sought under section 90;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: proceedings in which the validity of a patent is put in issue.

subsection.content: Subject to the modifications set out in paragraph (3), Order 24 applies to any proceedings to which this rule applies.

subsection.leadIn: The modifications are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the list of documents mentioned in Order 24, rule 2, must be served by each party to the proceedings within 21 days after the pleadings are deemed to be closed under Order 18; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: documents from any of the following classes (exempt class) are not required to be listed—

subparagraph.content: subject to the condition set out in paragraph (4), for proceedings involving an alleged infringement of a patent by a product or process—documents showing the nature and characteristics of the product or process and relating to the issue of whether the product or process falls within the claims in the specification of the patent;

documents relating to any ground on which the validity of a patent is put in issue, except documents that came into existence within the period beginning 2 years before the filing date of the patent application or, if priority is claimed, the earliest claimed priority date and ending 2 years after that date;
documents relating to the issue of commercial success of a patent.

subsection.content: The condition set out for paragraph (3)(b)(i) is that, before serving a list of documents, the party against whom the allegation of infringement is made has served on the other parties full particulars of the product or process, including, if necessary, drawings or other illustrations, that are verified by a statement of truth in accordance with Order 41A.

subsection.leadIn: If the issue of commercial success relating to an article or product arises in any proceedings, the proprietor of the patent concerned must, within the period specified in paragraph (3)(a), serve on the other parties to the proceedings a schedule containing—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a summary by convenient periods of sales of any such article or product;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a summary for the equivalent periods of sales, if any, of any equivalent prior article or product marketed before the article or product mentioned in subparagraph (a); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a summary by convenient periods of any expenditure on advertising and promotion that supported the marketing of the articles or products mentioned in subparagraphs (a) and (c).

subsection.leadIn: If the issue of commercial success relating to the use of a process arises in any proceedings, the proprietor of the patent concerned must, within the period specified in paragraph (3)(a), serve on the other parties to the proceedings a schedule containing—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a summary by convenient periods of the revenues received from the use of the process;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a summary for the equivalent periods of the revenues, if any, received from the use of any equivalent prior process used before the process mentioned in subparagraph (a); and

paragraph.name: d
