paragraph.content: where proceedings have not been instituted, indicate when it is intended that they should be instituted.

subsection.content: A summons under paragraph (1) shall be entitled in the matter of the defendant, naming him, and in the matter of the Ordinance, and all subsequent documents in the matter shall be so entitled.
Unless the Court otherwise directs, an affidavit under paragraph (2) may contain statements of information or belief with the sources and grounds of the information or belief.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Restraint order and charging order (O. 117, r. 5)

subsection.content: A restraint order may be made subject to conditions and exceptions, including but not limited to conditions relating to the indemnifying of third parties against expenses incurred in complying with the order, and exceptions relating to reasonable living and legal expenses of the defendant, but the Secretary for Justice shall not be required to give an undertaking to abide by any order as to damages sustained by the defendant as a result of the restraint order.

Unless the Court otherwise directs, a restraint order made ex parte shall have effect until a day which shall be fixed for the hearing inter partes of the application and a charging order shall be an order to show cause, imposing the charge until such day.

Where a restraint order is made the Secretary for Justice shall serve copies of the order and of the affidavit in support on the defendant and on all other named persons restrained by the order and shall notify all other persons or bodies affected by the order of its terms.

subsection.leadIn: Where a charging order is made the Secretary for Justice shall— (L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless the Court otherwise directs, serve copies of the order and of the affidavit in support on the defendant and, where the property to which the order relates is held by another person, on that person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the order on such of the persons or bodies specified in Order 50, rule 2(1)(b) to (d) as shall be appropriate.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Discharge or variation of order (O. 117, r. 6)

subsection.content: Any person or body on whom a restraint order or a charging order is served or who is notified of such an order may apply by summons to discharge or vary the order.

The summons and any affidavit in support shall be lodged with the Court and served on the Secretary for Justice and, where he is not the applicant, on the defendant, not less than 2 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the summons. (L.N. 362 of 1997)

Upon the Court being notified that proceedings for the offences have been concluded or that the amount payment of which is secured by a charging order has been paid into court, any restraint order or charging order, as the case may be, shall be discharged.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Further application by Secretary for Justice (O. 117, r. 7)

subsection.leadIn: Where a restraint order or a charging order has been made the Secretary for Justice may apply by summons or, where the case is one of urgency, ex parte— (L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to discharge or vary such order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a restraint order or a charging order in respect of other realisable property; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the appointment of a receiver.

subsection.content: An application under paragraph (1) shall be supported by an affidavit which, where the application is for a restraint order or a charging order, shall to the best of the deponent’s ability give full particulars of the realisable property in respect of which the order is sought and specify the person or persons holding such property.

The summons and affidavit in support shall be lodged with the Court and served on the defendant and, where one has been appointed in the matter, on the receiver, not less than 2 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the summons.
Rule 5(3) and (4) shall apply to the service of restraint orders and charging orders respectively made under this rule on persons other than the defendant.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Consent order for variation of restraint order or charging order (O. 117, r. 8)
section.content: Order 42, rule 5A shall apply to an order for the variation of a restraint order or a charging order pursuant to rule 6 or 7 as it applies to an order for the dismissal, discontinuance or withdrawal of such an order.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Realisation of property (O. 117, r. 9)

subsection.content: An application under section 17 shall, where there have been proceedings against the defendant in the Court of First Instance, be made by the Secretary for Justice by summons and shall otherwise be made by originating summons. (L.N. 362 of 1997; 25 of 1998 s. 2; L.N. 152 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: The summons or originating summons, as the case may be, shall be served with the evidence in support not less than 7 days before the date fixed for the hearing of the summons on— (L.N. 152 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the defendant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person holding any interest in the realisable property to which the application relates; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the receiver, where one has been appointed in the matter.

subsection.content: The application shall be supported by an affidavit, which shall, to the best of the deponent’s ability, give full particulars of the realisable property to which it relates and specify the person or persons holding such property, and a copy of the confiscation order, of any certificate issued by the Court under section 11(2) and of any charging order made in the matter shall be exhibited to such affidavit.
The Court may, on an application under section 17, exercise the power conferred by section 18(1) to direct the making of payments by the receiver.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Receivers (O. 117, r. 10)

subsection.content: Subject to this rule, the provisions of Order 30, rules 2 to 8 shall apply where a receiver is appointed in pursuance of a charging order or under section 15 or 17.

Where the receiver proposed to be appointed has been appointed receiver in other proceedings under the Ordinance, it shall not be necessary for an affidavit of fitness to be sworn or for the receiver to give security, unless the Court otherwise orders.

Where a receiver has fully paid the amount payable under the confiscation order and any sums remain in his hands, he shall apply by case management summons as to the distribution of such sums. (L.N. 152 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: A summons under paragraph (3) shall be served with any evidence in support not less than 7 days before the date fixed for the hearing of the summons on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the defendant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person who held property realised by the receiver.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Variation of confiscation order (O. 117, r. 11)

subsection.content: The Secretary for Justice or defendant may apply by summons for an order under section 20(1).

subsection.leadIn: The summons shall be served, with any supporting evidence, not less than 7 days before the date fixed for the hearing of the summons on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the Secretary for Justice is making the application, the defendant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the defendant is making the application, the Secretary for Justice,

subsection.continued: and, in either case, on the receiver, where one has been appointed in the matter.

subsection.content: The Secretary for Justice may apply by summons for an order under section 20(1A). (90 of 1995 s. 27)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Compensation (O. 117, r. 12)
section.content: An application for an order under section 29 shall be made by summons, which shall be served, with any supporting evidence, on the person alleged to be in default and on the Secretary for Justice not less than 7 days before the date fixed for the hearing of the summons.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Disclosure of information (O. 117, r. 13)

subsection.content: An application under section 28 shall be made by the Secretary for Justice by summons, which shall state the nature of the order sought and whether material sought to be disclosed is to be disclosed to a receiver appointed under section 15 or 17 or in pursuance of a charging order or to an authorized officer. (L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: The summons and affidavit in support shall be served on the public body—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not less than 7 days before the date fixed for the hearing of the summons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the public body is a Government department, in accordance with Order 77, rule 4.

subsection.content: The affidavit in support shall state the grounds for believing that the conditions in section 28(4) and, if appropriate, section 28(7) are fulfilled.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Statement relating to specified offence or organized crime (O. 117, r. 14)

subsection.content: Where in any proceedings the Secretary for Justice or the defendant proposes to tender to the Court any statement or other document under section 10 he shall give a copy of the statement or other document as soon as practicable to the defendant or the Secretary for Justice, as the case may be, and to the appropriate officer of the Court.

subsection.leadIn: A statement tendered to the Court by the Secretary for Justice under section 10(1) shall include the following particulars, namely— (90 of 1995 s. 27; L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the defendant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the person by whom the statement is tendered;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the statement is tendered after the defendant has been convicted, the date on which and the place where the relevant conviction occurred;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: such information known to the person who made the statement as is relevant to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: where section 8(1)(a)(ii) is applicable, the determination—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: whether the defendant could have been convicted in respect of the specified offence or offences concerned;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: whether the specified offence or any of the specified offences concerned could have been an organized crime;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the determination whether the defendant has benefited from a specified offence or an organized crime;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the assessment of the value of the defendant’s proceeds of a specified offence or an organized crime. (90 of 1995 s. 27)

section.name: s117A
section.heading: United Nations (Anti-Terrorism Measures) Ordinance (Cap. 575)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation (O. 117A, r. 1)

subsection.leadIn: In this Order—
subsection.def: expedited originating summons (速辦原訴傳票) means an originating summons in Form No. 10 in Appendix A;
the Ordinance (《條例》) means the United Nations (Anti-Terrorism Measures) Ordinance (Cap. 575);
subject person (標的人士), in relation to an application under section 5(1)(a), means the person who is the subject of the application;
subject property (標的財產), in relation to an application under section 5(1)(b) or 13, means the property that is the subject of the application.

subsection.content: An expression used in this Order that is used in the Ordinance has the same meaning in this Order as in the Ordinance.
A section referred to by number in this Order means the section so numbered in the Ordinance.

def.name: PrescribedInterest
def.leadIn: For the purposes of the Ordinance (under which a person who has a prescribed interest in any property is deemed to be a person by, for or on behalf of whom the property is or was held), prescribed interest (訂明權益), in relation to any property, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a legal or equitable estate or interest in the property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a right, power or privilege in connection with the property.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Judge to exercise jurisdiction (O. 117A, r. 2)
section.content: The jurisdiction of the Court under the Ordinance must, for the purposes of this Order, be exercised by a judge of the Court.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Ex parte application to specify person as terrorist or terrorist associate (O. 117A, r. 3)

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 5(1)(a) for an order to specify a person as a terrorist or terrorist associate may be made ex parte if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there exist circumstances of urgency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the whereabouts of the subject person are not known to the applicant, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the applicant has taken reasonable steps to ascertain the whereabouts of the subject person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a notice of the applicant’s intention to make the application, addressed to the subject person, has been published in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The ex parte application must be made by an ex parte originating summons supported by an affidavit.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit in support must state the grounds for believing that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: this rule applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the subject person is a terrorist or terrorist associate.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after obtaining an order under section 5(2) on an ex parte application, the applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish the order in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the whereabouts of the subject person are known or have become known to the applicant, serve the order, the ex parte originating summons and a copy of the affidavit in support on the subject person.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Inter partes application to specify person as terrorist or terrorist associate (O. 117A, r. 4)

subsection.content: This rule applies if an application under section 5(1)(a) is made other than in the circumstances referred to in rule 3(1)(a) and (b).
The application must be made by an expedited originating summons supported by an affidavit.
The affidavit in support must state the grounds for believing that the subject person is a terrorist or terrorist associate.
The expedited originating summons and a copy of the affidavit in support must be served on the subject person not less than 7 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application.

If a subject person served with the expedited originating summons wishes to adduce any affidavit evidence in opposition to it, the person must, within 28 days after the service, file an affidavit of evidence with the Court and serve a copy of the affidavit on the Secretary for Justice.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Additional affidavit procedure for application under section 5(1)(a) (O. 117A, r. 5)

subsection.content: This rule applies if, after the application referred to in rule 4 is made, the applicant cannot serve the expedited originating summons on the subject person because the whereabouts of the subject person have become unknown to the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant may file with the Court an additional affidavit that complies with paragraph (3) if the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has taken reasonable steps to ascertain the whereabouts of the subject person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has published a notice of the applicant’s intention to proceed with the application, addressed to the subject person, in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The additional affidavit referred to in paragraph (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state that the applicant believes that this rule applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the facts showing that the applicant has done the acts referred to in paragraph (2)(a) and (b).

subsection.leadIn: The Court may direct that the application be heard in the absence of the subject person, if the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: this rule applies; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the applicant has done the acts referred to in paragraph (2)(a) and (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to the nature and circumstances of the application, thinks it just and expedient so to do.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after obtaining an order under section 5(2) on an application to which this rule applies, the applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish the order in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the whereabouts of the subject person have become known to the applicant, serve the order, the expedited originating summons, a copy of the affidavit in support and a copy of the additional affidavit on the subject person.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Ex parte application to specify property as terrorist property (O. 117A, r. 6)

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 5(1)(b) for an order to specify any property as terrorist property may be made ex parte if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there exist circumstances of urgency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the whereabouts of the holder are not known to the applicant, or if there is more than one holder, the whereabouts of none of them are known to the applicant, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the applicant has taken reasonable steps to ascertain the whereabouts of that holder or those holders; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a notice of the applicant’s intention to make the application, addressed to that holder or those holders, has been published in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The ex parte application must be made by an ex parte originating summons supported by an affidavit.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit in support must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: state the grounds for believing that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: this rule applies; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the subject property is terrorist property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the holder, or if there is more than one holder, specify all the holders.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after obtaining an order under section 5(2) on an ex parte application, the applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish the order in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the whereabouts of the holder or holders specified in the affidavit in support are known or have become known to the applicant, serve the order, the ex parte originating summons and a copy of the affidavit in support on that holder or each of those holders.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Inter partes application to specify property as terrorist property (O. 117A, r. 7)

subsection.content: This rule applies if an application under section 5(1)(b) is made other than in the circumstances referred to in rule 6(1)(a) and (b).
The application must be made by an expedited originating summons supported by an affidavit.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit in support must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the grounds for believing that the subject property is terrorist property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the holder, or if there is more than one holder, specify all the holders, and their whereabouts (if known to the applicant).

subsection.content: The expedited originating summons and a copy of the affidavit in support must be served on the holder, or each holder specified in the affidavit whose whereabouts are known to the applicant, not less than 7 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application.

subsection.leadIn: If a person served with the expedited originating summons wishes to adduce any affidavit evidence in opposition to it, the person must, within 28 days after the service, file an affidavit of evidence with the Court and serve a copy of the affidavit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the Secretary for Justice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on any other holder specified in the affidavit in support whose whereabouts are known to the applicant.

subsection.content: The person who files an affidavit of evidence under paragraph (5) may also serve a copy of the affidavit on any other person whom that person believes to be a person by, for or on behalf of whom the subject property is held.
The service under paragraph (6) must be effected within the period referred to in paragraph (5).

section.name: s8
section.heading: Additional affidavit procedure for application under section 5(1)(b) (O. 117A, r. 8)

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the application referred to in rule 7, there is more than one holder and the whereabouts of one or more (but not all) of the holders are not known to the applicant at the time the application is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the application referred to in rule 7 is made, the applicant cannot serve the expedited originating summons on the holder, or if there is more than one holder, on one or more of them, because the whereabouts of that holder or those holders have become unknown to the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant may file with the Court an additional affidavit that complies with paragraph (3) if the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has taken reasonable steps to ascertain the whereabouts of the holder or holders that are not known or have become unknown; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has published a notice of the applicant’s intention to make or proceed with the application, addressed to the holder or holders whose whereabouts are not known or have become unknown, in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The additional affidavit referred to in paragraph (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state that the applicant believes that this rule applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the facts showing that the applicant has done the acts referred to in paragraph (2)(a) and (b).

subsection.content: The applicant must, within 7 days after filing the additional affidavit, serve a copy of the additional affidavit on each holder whose whereabouts are known to the applicant (if any).

subsection.leadIn: The Court may direct that the application be heard in the absence of a holder whose whereabouts are not known or have become unknown to the applicant, if the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: this rule applies; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the applicant has done the acts referred to in paragraph (2)(a) and (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to the nature and circumstances of the application, thinks it just and expedient so to do.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after obtaining an order under section 5(2) on an application to which this rule applies, the applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish the order in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the whereabouts of the holder or holders in whose absence the application was heard have become known to the applicant, serve the order, the expedited originating summons, a copy of the affidavit in support and a copy of the additional affidavit on that holder or each of those holders.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Ex parte application for forfeiture of certain terrorist property (O. 117A, r. 9)

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 13 for an order to forfeit any terrorist property may be made ex parte if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there exist circumstances of urgency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the whereabouts of the holder are not known to the applicant, or if there is more than one holder, the whereabouts of none of them are known to the applicant, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the applicant has taken reasonable steps to ascertain the whereabouts of that holder or those holders; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a notice of the applicant’s intention to make the application, addressed to that holder or those holders, has been published in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The ex parte application must be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if in the Court there are existing proceedings conducted under the Ordinance in respect of the subject property, by a summons supported by an affidavit that complies with rule 11; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are no such proceedings, by an ex parte originating summons supported by an affidavit that complies with rule 11.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after obtaining an order under section 13 on an ex parte application, the applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish the order in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the whereabouts of the holder or holders specified in the affidavit in support are known or have become known to the applicant, serve the order, the summons or ex parte originating summons (as the case may be) and a copy of the affidavit in support on that holder or each of those holders.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Inter partes application for forfeiture of certain terrorist property (O. 117A, r. 10)

subsection.content: This rule applies if an application under section 13 is made other than in the circumstances referred to in rule 9(1)(a) and (b).

subsection.leadIn: The application must be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if in the Court there are existing proceedings conducted under the Ordinance in respect of the subject property, by a summons supported by an affidavit that complies with rule 11; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are no such proceedings, by an expedited originating summons supported by an affidavit that complies with rule 11.

subsection.content: The summons or expedited originating summons, and a copy of the affidavit in support, must be served on the holder, or each holder specified in the affidavit whose whereabouts are known to the applicant, not less than 14 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application.

subsection.leadIn: If a person served with the summons or expedited originating summons wishes to adduce any affidavit evidence in opposition to it, the person must, within 28 days after the service, file an affidavit of evidence with the Court and serve a copy of the affidavit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the Secretary for Justice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on any other holder specified in the affidavit in support whose whereabouts are known to the applicant.

subsection.content: The person who files an affidavit of evidence under paragraph (4) may also serve a copy of the affidavit on any other person whom that person believes to be a person by, for or on behalf of whom the subject property is held.
The service under paragraph (5) must be effected within the period referred to in paragraph (4).

section.name: s11
section.heading: Contents of affidavit in support for application under section 13 (O. 117A, r. 11)

subsection.content: The affidavit in support referred to in rule 9(2) must state the grounds for believing that rule 9 applies.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit in support referred to in rules 9(2) and 10(2) must state the grounds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for believing that the subject property is terrorist property referred to in paragraph (a) of the definition of terrorist property in section 2(1) and for believing that it also—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in whole or in part, directly or indirectly, represents any proceeds arising from a terrorist act;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is intended to be used to finance or otherwise assist the commission of a terrorist act; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: was used to finance or otherwise assist the commission of a terrorist act; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for believing that the subject property is terrorist property referred to in paragraph (b) of that definition.

subsection.content: The affidavit in support referred to in rules 9(2) and 10(2) must also specify the holder, or if there is more than one holder, specify all the holders, and their whereabouts (if known to the applicant).

section.name: s12
section.heading: Additional affidavit procedure for application under section 13 (O. 117A, r. 12)

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the application referred to in rule 10, there is more than one holder and the whereabouts of one or more (but not all) of the holders are not known to the applicant at the time the application is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the application referred to in rule 10 is made, the applicant cannot serve the summons or expedited originating summons on the holder, or if there is more than one holder, on one or more of them, because the whereabouts of that holder or those holders have become unknown to the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant may file with the Court an additional affidavit that complies with paragraph (3) if the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has taken reasonable steps to ascertain the whereabouts of the holder or holders that are not known or have become unknown; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has published a notice of the applicant’s intention to make or proceed with the application, addressed to the holder or holders whose whereabouts are not known or have become unknown, in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The additional affidavit referred to in paragraph (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state that the applicant believes that this rule applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the facts showing that the applicant has done the acts referred to in paragraph (2)(a) and (b).

subsection.content: The applicant must, within 7 days after filing the additional affidavit, serve a copy of the additional affidavit on each holder whose whereabouts are known to the applicant (if any).

subsection.leadIn: The Court may direct that the application be heard in the absence of a holder whose whereabouts are not known or have become unknown to the applicant, if the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: this rule applies; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the applicant has done the acts referred to in paragraph (2)(a) and (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to the nature and circumstances of the application, thinks it just and expedient so to do.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after obtaining an order under section 13 on an application to which this rule applies, the applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish the order in a Chinese newspaper and an English newspaper that circulate generally in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the whereabouts of the holder or holders in whose absence the application was heard have become known to the applicant, serve the order, the summons or expedited originating summons (as the case may be), a copy of the affidavit in support and a copy of the additional affidavit on that holder or each of those holders.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Revocation of order specifying person as terrorist or terrorist associate or specifying property as terrorist property (O. 117A, r. 13)

subsection.content: An application under section 5(5) to revoke, in whole or in part, an order under section 5(2) may be made ex parte.
The ex parte application must be made by a summons supported by an affidavit.

The affidavit in support must state the circumstances that have caused the applicant to have reasonable grounds to believe that the person who or the property that is the subject of the application is not, or is no longer, a terrorist, terrorist associate or terrorist property (as the case may be).

section.name: s14
section.heading: Application under section 12A, 12B, 12C or 12G (O. 117A, r. 14)

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies to an application for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order under section 12A(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order under section 12B(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a warrant under section 12C(1); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a warrant under section 12G(1).

subsection.content: An application to which this rule applies must be made by laying an information on oath.
The application may, if a judge so directs, be heard at a place other than within the court premises.
At the hearing of the application, the Court may receive evidence from the applicant.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Revocation or variation of order made under section 12A or 12B (O. 117A, r. 15)

subsection.leadIn: An application under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 12A(13) for the revocation or variation of an order under section 12A(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 12B(8) for the revocation or variation of an order under section 12B(2) or (7),

subsection.continued: must be made to a judge by a summons supported by an affidavit.

subsection.content: The summons and affidavit in support must state the grounds on which the applicant seeks the revocation or variation of the order.
The summons and a copy of the affidavit in support must be served on the Secretary for Justice not less than 3 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application.
At the hearing of the application, the Court may revoke the order or make such variation as it thinks fit.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Claim of legal privilege in relation to order under section 12A or 12B (O. 117A, r. 16)

subsection.leadIn: If, in the course of the exercise of powers conferred by an order under section 12A to require a person to answer questions or otherwise furnish information, a claim of legal privilege is made in respect of any information, the person making the claim must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 3 days of making the claim, apply to the Court by a summons supported by an affidavit for a declaration that the information is an item subject to legal privilege; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than 3 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application, serve the summons and a copy of the affidavit in support on the Secretary for Justice.

subsection.leadIn: If, in the course of the exercise of powers conferred by an order under section 12A or 12B to require a person to produce material or to give an authorized officer access to it, a claim of legal privilege is made in respect of any material, the person making the claim must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the presence of an authorized officer, secure the material in a sealed container;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately deposit the sealed container with the Court;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: within 3 days of depositing the material with the Court, apply to the Court by a summons supported by an affidavit for a declaration that the material is an item subject to legal privilege; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: not less than 3 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application, serve the summons and a copy of the affidavit in support on the Secretary for Justice.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Claim of legal privilege in relation to warrant under section 12C or 12G (O. 117A, r. 17)
section.leadIn: If, in the course of the execution by an authorized officer of a warrant issued under section 12C or 12G, a claim of legal privilege is made in respect of any thing, the person making the claim must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: within 3 days of making the claim, apply to the Court by a summons supported by an affidavit for a declaration that the thing is an item subject to legal privilege; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not less than 3 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application, serve the summons and a copy of the affidavit in support on the authorized officer and the Secretary for Justice.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Application to be heard in camera (O. 117A, r. 18)

subsection.content: An application under section 12A, 12B, 12C or 12G must be heard in camera.

The information and all other documents relating to the application must be treated as confidential and must, immediately on the determination of the application, be placed in a packet and sealed by order of the judge by whom the application was heard.

subsection.leadIn: The packet must be kept in the custody of the Court in a place to which the public has no access or in such other place as the judge may authorize and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not be opened nor must its contents be removed except by order of a judge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be destroyed except pursuant to an order of the Court.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Application for continued detention of seized property under section 12H(2) (O. 117A, r. 19)

subsection.content: An application under section 12H(2) for an order to authorize the continued detention of seized property must be made by an ex parte originating summons supported by an affidavit.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit in support must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: state the grounds for suspecting that the seized property is terrorist property; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: give particulars, in terms of the matters referred to in section 12H(2)(b), as to why the continued detention of the seized property is justified.

subsection.leadIn: If an order is made under section 12H(2) in respect of any seized property, the applicant for the order must, as soon as practicable, serve the order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the person from whom the property was seized; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on each person whom the applicant can reasonably ascertain to be a person by, for or on behalf of whom the property was held immediately before it was seized.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Application for further detention of seized property under section 12H(3) (O. 117A, r. 20)

subsection.content: An application under section 12H(3) for an order to authorize the further detention of seized property must be made by a summons supported by an affidavit in the proceedings commenced under rule 19.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit in support must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the grounds for suspecting that the seized property is terrorist property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give particulars, in terms of the matters referred to in section 12H(2)(b), as to why the further detention of the seized property is justified.

subsection.content: The summons and a copy of the affidavit in support must be served not less than 5 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application on each affected person.

subsection.leadIn: If a person served with the summons wishes to adduce any affidavit evidence in opposition to it, the person must, not less than 2 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application, file an affidavit of evidence with the Court and serve a copy of the affidavit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the Secretary for Justice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on every other affected person.

subsection.content: If an order is made under section 12H(3), the applicant for the order must, as soon as practicable, serve the order on each affected person.
In this rule and rules 21 and 22, affected person (受影響的人), in relation to the seized property, means a person on whom an order has been served under rule 19(3) in respect of that property.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Application for release of seized property under section 12H(4) (O. 117A, r. 21)

subsection.content: An application under section 12H(4)(a) for the release of seized property detained by an order under section 12H(2) or (3) must be made by a summons supported by an affidavit stating the grounds on which the application is made.

subsection.leadIn: The summons and a copy of the affidavit in support must be served not less than 5 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the Secretary for Justice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on each affected person.

subsection.content: An application under section 12H(4)(b) for the release of seized property detained by an order under section 12H(2) or (3) must be made ex parte by a summons supported by an affidavit stating the grounds on which the application is made.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Release of seized property (O. 117A, r. 22)
section.leadIn: If, in relation to any seized property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order under section 12H(2) expires without an order being made under section 12H(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order under section 12H(3) expires without a further order being made under that section; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a direction is obtained under section 12H(4),

section.continued: then, subject to section 12H(5) and unless the Court has directed that an issue be stated and tried as between the affected persons, the property must be forthwith released, on such terms, if any, as the Court thinks fit, to the person from whom the property was seized or to such other person as appears to be entitled to it.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Application to Court to revoke order made under section 5(2) or notice given under section 6(1 (O. 117A, r. 23)

subsection.content: An application under section 17(1)(a) to revoke, in whole or in part, an order under section 5(2) that has been made ex parte must be made by a summons.

For the purposes of paragraph (1) and section 17(1)(a), if an order under section 5(2) has been obtained by an application heard in the absence of the subject person or a holder under rule 5 or 8, in relation to that subject person or holder only, the application and the order are regarded to have been made ex parte.

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 17(1)(b) to revoke, in whole or in part, a notice under section 6(1) must be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if in the Court there are existing proceedings conducted under the Ordinance in respect of the property that is the subject of the application, by a summons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are no such proceedings, by an expedited originating summons.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Application concerning direction mentioned in section 6(10) or licence mentioned in section 6(1), 8 or 8A (O. 117A, r. 24)

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 17(4) for the revocation or variation of a direction mentioned in section 6(10) or for the grant or variation of a licence mentioned in section 6(1), 8 or 8A must be made— (14 of 2018 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if in the Court there are existing proceedings conducted under the Ordinance in respect of the property or financial (or related) services that is or are the subject of the application, by a summons; or (20 of 2012 s. 10)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are no such proceedings, by an expedited originating summons.

subsection.content: If any affidavit in opposition to the summons or expedited originating summons has been filed with the Court, a copy of the affidavit must be served on the applicant not less than 3 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Application for compensation (O. 117A, r. 25)

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 18 for an order for compensation must be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if in the Court there are existing proceedings conducted under the Ordinance in respect of the person or property to whom or which the application relates, by a summons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are no such proceedings, by an expedited originating summons.

subsection.leadIn: The summons or expedited originating summons, and a copy of any affidavit in support, must be served not less than 14 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the Secretary for Justice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on any other person on whose part, it is alleged, there has been default.

subsection.content: If any affidavit in opposition to the summons or expedited originating summons has been filed with the Court, a copy of the affidavit must be served by the Secretary for Justice on the applicant not less than 7 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Affidavits containing statements of information or belief (O. 117A, r. 26)
section.content: If an affidavit referred to in this Order contains a statement of information or belief, it must also contain the sources and grounds of the information or belief unless the Court otherwise directs.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Service out of jurisdiction (O. 117A, r. 27)
section.content: The service of any document under this Order out of the jurisdiction is permissible with the leave of the Court.

section.name: s118
section.heading: Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1)
section.crossHeading: Part XII—Search and Seizure of Journalistic Material

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation (O. 118, r. 1)
section.content: In this Order the Ordinance (條例) means the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), and a section referred to by number means the section so numbered in the Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application (O. 118, r. 2)
section.content: This Order applies to proceedings under sections 84, 85 and 87.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Proceedings under section 84 (O. 118, r. 3)

subsection.content: An application for an order under section 84 may be made by originating summons in the expedited form supported by affidavit. (L.N. 152 of 2008)
The affidavit shall contain the evidence relied on to show that the conditions set out in section 84(3) have been fulfilled.
Unless the court otherwise directs, the affidavit may contain statements of information or belief with the sources and grounds of such information or belief.

Notwithstanding Order 28, rule 1A, a copy of the originating summons and affidavit shall be served on the respondent not less than 3 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the application.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Proceedings under section 85 (O. 118, r. 4)

subsection.content: An application for a warrant under section 85 shall be made ex parte by originating summons in Form No. 11 in Appendix A supported by affidavit. (L.N. 152 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state which of the grounds set out in section 85 is relied on;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the evidence relied on in support of those grounds; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the name, rank, title and address of the officer who has approved the making of the application.

subsection.content: Unless the court otherwise directs, the affidavit may contain statements of information or belief with the sources and grounds of such information or belief.
All applications under section 85 shall be heard in chambers.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Proceedings under section 87 (O. 118, r. 5)

subsection.content: An application for an order under section 87 shall be made by summons which may be supported by affidavit.
The summons shall set out the grounds on which the applicant relies.

A copy of the summons and affidavit (if any) shall be served on the person named in the warrant pursuant to section 86(1)(a) by delivering it to him not less than 3 clear days before the date fixed for the hearing of the summons.

Unless the court otherwise directs, a party wishing to adduce evidence shall do so by affidavit, and such affidavit may contain statements of information or belief with the sources and grounds of such information or belief.

section.name: s119
section.heading: Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation (O.119, r. 1)

subsection.def: In this Order the Ordinance (條例) means the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201), and a section referred to by number means the section so numbered in the Ordinance.

subsection.content: Expressions used in this Order which are used in the Ordinance have the same meanings in this Order as in the Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application of this Order (O. 119, r. 2)
section.content: This Order applies to an application made to the Court under Part III of the Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Assignment of proceedings (O. 119, r. 3)
section.content: An application to which this Order applies shall be heard by a judge in chambers.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Form of application (O. 119, r. 4)
section.content: Subject to rule 6, an application to which this Order applies shall be made ex parte by originating summons in Form No. 11 in Appendix A and, except for an application made under section 14D of the Ordinance, be supported by affidavit.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Restriction on access to documents, etc. (O. 119, r. 5)

subsection.content: The originating summons, affidavit, if any, information and all other documents relating to the application shall be treated as confidential and shall, immediately on the determination of the application, be placed in a packet and sealed by order of the judge by whom the application was heard. (L.N. 152 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: The packet shall be kept in the custody of the Court in a place to which the public has no access or in such other place as the judge may authorize and shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be opened;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have its contents removed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be copied; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be destroyed,

subsection.continued: except by order of a judge.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Variation or revocation of orders (O. 119, r. 6)

subsection.content: An application made under section 14D of the Ordinance shall be made by summons issued in the proceedings in which the order which it is sought to vary or revoke was made and shall state, so far as the applicant is able, the grounds on which the application is made.
The summons and any affidavit in support shall be served on the Commissioner not less than 3 clear days before the hearing of the application.

section.name: s120
section.heading: Charitable Trusts

section.name: s1
section.heading: Appointment or removal of trustee (O. 120, r. 1)
section.content: Where the appointment or removal of any trustee or any other relief, order or direction relating to any charity is deemed desirable, any person mentioned in rule 3 of this Order may make application by summons (without any information, action or petition) to the Court in chambers for such relief, order or direction as the nature of the case may require.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Powers of Court (O. 120, r. 2)
section.leadIn: The Court may proceed upon and dispose of such application in chambers, unless it thinks fit otherwise to direct, and shall and may have and exercise thereupon all jurisdiction, power and authority, and may make such orders and give such directions relating to the matter of such application, as might now be exercised, made or given by the Court in an action regularly instituted, or upon petition as the case may require: (L.N. 122 of 2017)
section.proviso: Provided that the Court may, where in the circumstances of any such application it sees fit, direct that, for obtaining the relief, order or direction sought for by such application, an information, action or petition, as the case may require, shall be brought or presented and prosecuted, and abstain from further proceeding on such application.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Applications (O. 120, r. 3)
section.leadIn: An application under rule 1 of this Order may be made by— (L.N. 122 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary for Justice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all or any one or more of the trustees or persons administering the trust, or persons claiming to administer the trust, or persons otherwise interested in the trust; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of any relief, order or direction sought under section 57A of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29), 2 or more persons who have the consent in writing of the Secretary for Justice to make the application.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Secretary for Justice to be made party to certain applications (O. 120, r. 4)
section.content: Where an application under rule 1 of this Order is made by any trustee or person referred to in rule 3(b) of this Order, the Secretary for Justice shall be made a party to the application unless the Court otherwise orders.

section.name: s121
section.heading: Child Abduction and Custody Ordinance (Cap. 512)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation (O. 121, r. 1)

subsection.leadIn: In this Order, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: application (申請) means an application under the Convention or the Ordinance;
Ordinance (《條例》) means the Child Abduction and Custody Ordinance (Cap. 512);
relevant authority (有關當局) includes the Court, a District Court and a juvenile court. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

subsection.content: Expressions used in this Order which are used in the Ordinance have the same meanings in this Order as in the Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Mode of application (O. 121, r. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in the Ordinance and in paragraphs (1A) and (2), an originating application under the Ordinance may be made by originating summons in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (subject to subparagraph (b)) Form No. 10A in Appendix A; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the application is made ex parte as provided in this Order) Form No. 10B in Appendix A. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: If there are existing proceedings commenced under the Ordinance in Hong Kong, an application may be made by summons. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

Where an applicant seeks a direction under rule 9 without having filed an originating summons, the Court may, on sufficient cause being shown, allow such an application to be made on the applicant’s undertaking to the Court to issue an originating summons as soon as possible and on such other terms, if any, as the Court thinks fit.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application for return of a child (O. 121, r. 3)

subsection.leadIn: An application for the return of a child under the Ordinance shall be supported by an affidavit sworn by the applicant or, if the circumstances of the case justify it, a person duly authorized to swear it on behalf of the applicant, and the affidavit shall, so far as it is possible to do so— (L.N. 3 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: state the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the matters specified in Article 8(a) to (d) of the Convention;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if applicable, the matters stated in Article 8(e) and (f) of the Convention;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: particulars of any pending or concluded proceedings, including proceedings out of Hong Kong, relating to the child;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any other information which may assist in securing the return of the child;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exhibit all relevant documents.

subsection.content: The affidavit must be filed at the same time as the application. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

subsection.leadIn: However, for an urgent case, the affidavit may be filed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the time specified by the Court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no time is specified by the Court) as soon as possible after the application. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

section.name: s4
section.heading:
Application for a declaration under section 10 of the Ordinance
(O. 121, r. 4)

subsection.leadIn: An application for a declaration that the removal or retention of the child was wrongful shall be supported by an affidavit sworn by the applicant or, if the circumstances of the case justify it, by a person duly authorized to swear it on behalf of the applicant, and the affidavit shall, so far as is possible—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: full particulars of the request made by the requesting state;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the matters specified in Article 8(a) to (c) of the Convention and all other facts on which the applicant relies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exhibit all relevant documents.

subsection.content: The affidavit must be filed at the same time as the application. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

subsection.leadIn: However, for an urgent case, the affidavit may be filed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the time specified by the Court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no time is specified by the Court) as soon as possible after the application. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

subsection.content: The application may be made ex parte. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Respondents to application for return of child (O. 121, r. 5)

subsection.leadIn: The following persons shall be made respondents to an application for the return of a child— (L.N. 3 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the person with whom the child is alleged in the affidavit to be;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any parent or guardian of the child who is not otherwise a party;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person in whose favour a decision, including a decision of a relevant authority in a Contracting State other than Hong Kong, relating to custody has been made, if he is not otherwise a party; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other person who has a sufficient interest in the welfare of the child.

subsection.content: The persons referred to in paragraph (1)(b) to (e) shall be made respondents to an application under section 10 of the Ordinance. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Time for acknowledging service (O. 121, r. 6)
section.leadIn: The time limited for acknowledging service of an originating summons issued pursuant to rule 2 is— (L.N. 3 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (subject to subparagraph (b)) 7 days after the service of the originating summons, including the day of service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the service takes place out of the jurisdiction) 14 days after the service of the originating summons, including the day of service.

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Hearing of originating summons (O. 121, r. 6A)

subsection.content: A day and time for the attendance of the parties before the Court for the hearing of an originating summons may be fixed on the application of the applicant.
If an originating summons is required to be served, the time limited for acknowledging service may, where appropriate, be abridged so as to expire on the 2nd day before the day so fixed.

subsection.leadIn: If an originating summons is required to be served and a day is fixed under paragraph (1) for the hearing of the originating summons, the applicant must, at least 4 clear days before that day, serve on the respondent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the originating summons and the affidavit required under this Order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the respondent has been served with the originating summons and the affidavit required under this Order) a notice of the day fixed for the hearing.

subsection.content: If the hearing of an originating summons required to be served is adjourned and any party to the proceedings desires to apply at the resumed hearing for any order or direction not previously asked for, that party must, at least 2 clear days before the resumed hearing of the originating summons, serve on the other party a notice specifying those orders and directions.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Further evidence (O. 121, r. 7)

subsection.content: Any respondent may within 5 days after acknowledging service of the originating summons file and serve on the other parties any affidavit on which he intends to rely.
The applicant may within 5 days thereafter file and serve on the respondent an affidavit in reply.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Assignment of proceedings (O. 121, r. 8)
section.content: Every application shall be heard and determined by a judge, except that applications to extend time and to join a respondent may be heard by a Master, and shall be dealt with in chambers unless the Court otherwise directs.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Interim directions (O. 121, r. 9)
section.content: An application for interim directions under section 7 of the Ordinance may, where the case is one of urgency, be made ex parte.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Stay of custody application pending determination of proceedings under the Convention (O. 121, r. 10)

subsection.content: A notice filed under section 20(2) of the Ordinance by a party to proceedings under the Convention must be verified by an affidavit sworn by that party or a person duly authorized to swear it on behalf of that party. (L.N. 3 of 2016)
The affidavit must be filed at the same time as the notice.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Authenticated copy of Court’s order (O. 121, r. 11)

subsection.content: A person who wishes to make an application under the Convention in a Contracting State other than Hong Kong and who wishes to obtain from the Court an authenticated copy of an order of the Court relating to the child in respect of whom the application is to be made shall apply in writing in that behalf to the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: An application under paragraph (1) shall specify, so far as it is possible to do so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and date of birth of the child;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of the order and the short title of the proceedings in which the order was made;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the relationship of the applicant to the child;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the address of the applicant.

subsection.content: On receipt of an application under this rule, the Registrar shall send by post to the applicant at the address indicated in the application an authenticated copy of the order or, if he is unable to locate the order, shall notify the applicant accordingly.

The authenticated copy of the order shall be an office copy sealed with the Seal of the Court and endorsed with a certificate signed by the Registrar certifying that the copy is a true copy of an order obtained in the Court and that it is issued for the purposes of the Convention.

section.name: s11A
section.heading: Application for a location order under section 15(2) of the Ordinance (O. 121, r. 11A)

subsection.leadIn: An application for a location order under section 15(2) of the Ordinance must be supported by an affidavit sworn by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person duly authorized to swear it on behalf of the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit must, as far as possible—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the particulars of the person who has, or may reasonably obtain, applicable information about the child;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: provide any other relevant information; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: exhibit all relevant documents.

subsection.content: The affidavit must be filed at the same time as the application.

subsection.leadIn: However, for an urgent case, the affidavit may be filed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the time specified by the Court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no time is specified by the Court) as soon as possible after the application.

subsection.content: The application may be made ex parte.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Application for an order under section 16(3) of the Ordinance: for prohibiting removal of child from Hong Kong to certain jurisdictions (O. 121, r. 12)

subsection.leadIn: An application for an order under section 16(3) of the Ordinance must be supported by an affidavit sworn by— (L.N. 3 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person duly authorized to swear it on behalf of the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit must, as far as possible, state the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars of the request made by the requesting Contracting State;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the particulars of the travel arrangements of the child and accompanying persons, including the dates of arrival and departure, and contact details while they are in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the child is in, or is being taken to, Hong Kong temporarily for enabling a person to exercise the rights of access to the child—

subparagraph.content: the basis for believing that the child may be wrongfully removed from Hong Kong to a jurisdiction other than the one mentioned in section 16(3)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance; or (L.N. 3 of 2016)
if that person consents to the making of the order sought—the particulars of the consent.

subsection.leadIn: In addition, the affidavit must, as far as possible, exhibit the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: all other relevant documents.

subsection.content: The affidavit must be filed at the same time as the application.

subsection.leadIn: However, for an urgent case, the affidavit may be filed— (L.N. 3 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the time specified by the Court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no time is specified by the Court) as soon as possible after the application. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

subsection.content: The application may be made ex parte. (L.N. 3 of 2016)

section.name: s12A
section.heading: Application for an order under section 16(4) of the Ordinance: for variation, discharge, suspension or revival (O. 121, r. 12A)

subsection.leadIn: An application for an order under section 16(4) of the Ordinance must be supported by an affidavit sworn by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person duly authorized to swear it on behalf of the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit must, as far as possible—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the ground of the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide any other relevant information; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: exhibit all relevant documents.

subsection.content: The affidavit must be filed at the same time as the application.

subsection.leadIn: However, for an urgent case, the affidavit may be filed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the time specified by the Court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no time is specified by the Court) as soon as possible after the application.

subsection.content: The application may be made ex parte.

section.name: s12B
section.heading: Application for a recovery order under section 17(2) of the Ordinance (O. 121, r. 12B)

subsection.leadIn: An application for a recovery order under section 17(2) of the Ordinance must be supported by an affidavit sworn by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person duly authorized to swear it on behalf of the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit must, as far as possible—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the particulars of the person with whom the child is believed to be;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the circumstances warranting the making of the order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide any other relevant information; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: exhibit all relevant documents.

subsection.content: The affidavit must be filed at the same time as the application.

subsection.leadIn: However, for an urgent case, the affidavit may be filed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the time specified by the Court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no time is specified by the Court) as soon as possible after the application.

subsection.content: The application may be made ex parte.

section.name: s12C
section.heading: Application for an order under section 21(3) of the Ordinance: for prohibiting removal of child out of Hong Kong (O. 121, r. 12C)

subsection.leadIn: An application for an order under section 21(3) of the Ordinance must be supported by an affidavit sworn by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person duly authorized to swear it on behalf of the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit must, as far as possible—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: provide the information set out in paragraph (3) about the following persons—

subparagraph.content: the child;
the applicant;
the person believed to be intending to remove, or to be removing, the child out of Hong Kong; and
the person specified in section 21(2)(a) of the Ordinance who has the custody of the child under a court order or who is exercising the rights of that custody (other than the applicant);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the basis for believing that the person mentioned in subparagraph (a)(iii) may remove the child out of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide any other relevant information; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: exhibit all relevant documents.

subsection.leadIn: The information includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following in respect of the child—

subparagraph.content: name (in both Chinese and English, if applicable);
date of birth (if available);
gender;
birth certificate number (if available);
Hong Kong Identity Card number (if available);
travel document number (if available); and
address (if available);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the following in respect of the applicant—

subparagraph.content: name (in both Chinese and English, if applicable);
gender;
Hong Kong Identity Card number or travel document number;
address;
contact telephone number; and
relationship with the child;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the following in respect of the person mentioned in paragraph (2)(a)(iii)—

subparagraph.content: name (in both Chinese and English, if applicable);
gender;
(if available) Hong Kong Identity Card number or travel document number;
address (if available);
contact telephone number (if available); and
relationship with the child; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the following in respect of the person mentioned in paragraph (2)(a)(iv)—

subparagraph.content: name (in both Chinese and English, if applicable);
gender;
(if available) Hong Kong Identity Card number or travel document number;
address (if available);
contact telephone number (if available); and
relationship with the child.

subsection.content: The affidavit must be filed at the same time as the application.

subsection.leadIn: However, for an urgent case, the affidavit may be filed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the time specified by the Court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no time is specified by the Court) as soon as possible after the application.

subsection.content: The application may be made ex parte.

section.name: s12D
section.heading: Application for an order under section 21(4) of the Ordinance: for variation, discharge, suspension or revival (O. 121, r. 12D)

subsection.leadIn: An application for an order under section 21(4) of the Ordinance must be supported by an affidavit sworn by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person duly authorized to swear it on behalf of the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The affidavit must, as far as possible—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the ground of the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide any other relevant information; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: exhibit all relevant documents.

subsection.content: The affidavit must be filed at the same time as the application.

subsection.leadIn: However, for an urgent case, the affidavit may be filed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the time specified by the Court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no time is specified by the Court) as soon as possible after the application.

subsection.content: The application may be made ex parte.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Searching for, inspecting and obtaining copies of documents filed in proceedings under the Ordinance (O. 121, r. 13)

subsection.leadIn: Unless otherwise directed by the Court, a party to any proceedings under the Ordinance or the party’s solicitor, or the Secretary for Justice, may do one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have a search in the Registry made for a document filed in the Registry in those proceedings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inspect or obtain a copy of the document.

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in paragraph (1), if a document is filed in the Registry in any proceedings under the Ordinance (other than an order made in open court)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the document is not open to inspection by any person without leave of the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no copy of the document, or of an extract from the document, may be taken by, or issued to, any person without leave of the Court.

section.name: s122
section.heading: Registered Designs Ordinance (Cap. 522)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation (O. 122, r. 1)

subsection.leadIn: In this Order—
subsection.def: Court (法院) means the Court of First Instance;
the Ordinance (《條例》) means the Registered Designs Ordinance (Cap. 522);
the Registered Designs Rules (《註冊外觀設計規則》) means the Registered Designs Rules (Cap. 522 sub. leg. A).

subsection.content: In this Order, a section referred to by number means the section so numbered in the Ordinance.
Expressions used in this Order that are used in the Ordinance have the same meaning in this Order as in the Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application (O. 122, r. 2)
section.content: These rules apply to proceedings brought before the Court under or for the purposes of the Ordinance subject to the provisions of this Order.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Proceedings to be begun by originating summons (O. 122, r. 3)

subsection.content: Proceedings under a provision of the Ordinance specified in column (A) of the Table, which relates to a matter the general description of which is set out in column (B) of the Table opposite to that provision, must be begun by originating summons in Form No. 8, 10 or 11 in Appendix A.

td.p: General description of matter to be brought before the Court
Question of right in a design after it has been registered.
Question of entitlement to grant of licence following a transfer of registered design under section 41.
Application for revocation of registration of design on the ground that the design was not registrable.
Application for revocation of registration of design on the ground that the person registered as owner is not entitled to be so registered.
Application for declaration regarding exclusive privileges and rights in design.

subsection.content: Paragraph (1) does not apply to a matter to be brought before the Court in proceedings that are pending before it.
Proceedings mentioned in rule 7(2) must be begun by originating summons in Form No. 10 or 11 in Appendix A.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Supplementary provisions relating to originating summons (O. 122, r. 4)

subsection.leadIn: An originating summons by which any proceedings under or for the purposes of the Ordinance are begun must, in addition to any other information required to be included by other provisions of this Order, include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a concise statement setting out the nature of the question referred to, or of the matter brought before, the Court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a summary of the facts, laws and nature of the evidence on which the person who takes out the originating summons relies in support of the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the order or relief sought.

subsection.content: Except as otherwise provided in this Order, Order 10 applies to the service of a copy of an originating summons required to be served under this Order as Order 10 applies to the service of an originating process.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Reference under section 41(1) (determination of rights after registration) (O. 122, r. 5)

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings in which a question is referred to the Court under section 41(1), the plaintiff must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the originating summons by which the proceedings are begun on the Registrar of Designs within 7 days after the issue of the originating summons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a written notice of the proceedings to the following persons at the same time when the originating summons is served under these rules on the defendant—

subparagraph.content: every person who is alleged in the originating summons to be entitled to a right in or under the registered design.
